_header: The book of marshalcy here shall begin
Subjects: introductions, to prose texts; horses; utilitarian instructions
_description: A verse introduction to a prose treatise on horses — seven couplets

BodWoodEmpt18.First Lines:
The booke of merschalsy here hit schall begynHe þat will with
                    yt crafte any goode wyn…
BodWoodEmpt18.Last Lines:
…Till þai be of age & myghtefull at nedeA knyght apon
                    to ride on euery dughty dede
BodWoodEmpt18.Editions:
Smith,  Sir Frederick. 
             The Early History of Veterinary Literature.
         London: Bailliere, Tindall, and Cox, 1919: 1.110.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
The boke of marchalsie here shall begynYe þat will with
                    þat Craft any honour wynne…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Tyll they be of age & myghtifull at nedeA knyght to Ride
                    vpon at euery dowghty dede
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
OxfBal354.Editions:
Flügel,  Ewald. 
             “Liedersammlungen des XVI Jahrhunderts….” 
             Anglia
         26 (1903): 94-285: 100.

BLHar5086.First Lines:
The booke of marchaulsye here it shall bygyneyee that wole with the
                    craft eny honour wyne…
BLHar5086.Last Lines:
…Tyl they ben of age and myhtfull atte nedeA knyght to ryde
                    vpon at euery douhty dede
BLHar5086.Attributed Title:
The boke of medycene for horses and to know of what cuntry the best horses
                    be bredin contaynyng 30 leves (f. 99).
